events.name: Quantum dot dot dot
events.description:
Saturday 19 Dec; 10am - 7pm  at ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE- in association with Centre for Quantum Technologies and supported by NUS Science Demonstration Lab volunteers come explore the quantum world with hands-on art science!

WHAT’S ON AT QUANTUM DOT DOT DOT?
-Seven exhibit zones for kids and adults. Collect stamps in the different zones to claim quantum scientist goodies!

Zone 1: Unconventional computing
Can you build a computer out of bubbles? How about billiard balls? What happens if you use quantum particles?

Zone 2: Virtual-reality lab visits
Experience what it’s like inside a cutting-edge quantum research lab. 

Zone 3: The Quantum Bunny
Take a bean-bag seat and read “Sir Fong’s Adventures in Science Book 5: the Quantum Bunny” for kids aged 9-14 Crayons and pencils supplied. 

Zone 4: The rainbow of light
Build your own ‘rainbowscope’ to take home using card, sellotape and a special piece of ‘diffraction grating’. 

Zone 5: Secret messaging
Try encoding your own secret messages using invisible ink or a cut-out-and-keep Caesar cipher- then advance to quantum cryptography. 

Zone 6: Quantum magnetic sensors
Meet the world’s smallest compass, a SQUID device chilled in liquid nitrogen and see quantum levitation! 

Zone 7: #ArtScienceonScreen
Screening of two quantum movies, watch:
•	10am-12pm, 1-4pm & 6-7pm: Quantum Shorts
•	12-1pm & 4-5pm: Reality Lost
